intro: Scopolia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has a tuberous root system and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Scopolia parviflora is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
